description: TimeEntryWorkItemContext type includes all required fields (workItemId, workItemType, workItemName) and optional context-specific fields
useSchedulingCallbacks returns default no-op callbacks when no provider is present
Default renderAgentSchedule returns a fallback alert element (not null)
Default launchTimeEntry shows toast message instead of crashing
SchedulingCallbackProvider overrides defaults with real callbacks when wrapped
SchedulingContext re-exported from packages/ui/src/context/index.ts
AgentScheduleView renders without error when given a valid agentId
AgentScheduleView calls getScheduleEntries with agent's ID and current date range
AgentScheduleView shows loading state while events are being fetched
AgentScheduleView defaults to week view
AgentScheduleView allows switching between day, week, and month views
Events are color-coded by work item type (ticket, project_task, interaction, etc.)
Clicking an event opens EntryPopup with event details
Calendar auto-scrolls to 8 AM on initial render
User with user_schedule:read can only see own schedule entries
User with user_schedule:read:all can see any agent's schedule entries
CalendarStyleProvider and AgentScheduleDrawerStyles are applied to the calendar
launchTimeEntryForWorkItem fetches current time period before opening dialog
launchTimeEntryForWorkItem creates/fetches time sheet for current user and period
launchTimeEntryForWorkItem builds correct IExtendedWorkItem from ticket context
launchTimeEntryForWorkItem builds correct IExtendedWorkItem from interaction context
launchTimeEntryForWorkItem builds correct IExtendedWorkItem from project task context
Toast error shown when no active time period exists
TimeEntryDialog opens in drawer mode (inDrawer=true) with correct props
TimeEntryDialog receives work item with pre-filled service for project tasks
Saving time entry calls saveTimeEntry action and closes drawer on success
onComplete callback is invoked after successful save (for timer reset)
MspSchedulingProvider provides renderAgentSchedule that returns AgentScheduleView
MspSchedulingProvider provides launchTimeEntry that calls launchTimeEntryForWorkItem
@alga-psa/scheduling listed in msp-composition package.json dependencies
Ticket detail page renders children inside MspSchedulingProvider
Contact detail page renders children inside MspSchedulingProvider
Project detail page renders children inside MspSchedulingProvider
AgentScheduleDrawer renders calendar (not stub alert) when provider is present
Clicking agent name from ticket detail opens agent schedule drawer
Clicking user name from interaction detail opens agent schedule drawer
Ticket Add Time Entry opens TimeEntryDialog with ticket_id, ticket_number, and title
Ticket Add Time Entry passes elapsedTime and timeDescription from timer state
Ticket Add Time Entry onComplete resets timer (elapsedTime=0, isRunning=false)
Interaction Add Time Entry opens TimeEntryDialog with interaction context (type, client, times)
Task Add Time Entry opens TimeEntryDialog with project/phase/task context and serviceId
Without MspSchedulingProvider, AgentScheduleDrawer shows fallback alert
Without MspSchedulingProvider, Add Time Entry shows fallback toast
